column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2018
column14: A little bit darker than I thought, but I LOVE IT!  This is Loreal with a lipstick makeover.  The color is a beautiful dark greige with a hint violet underneath, almost imperceptible, it s a very hard color to describe, but it fits with jeans, it fits with going out on a date, it is great without any other makeup.  I really love that way it can look punk or rock and roll or high society.  I collect millions of lipsticks, and only have about five that I really like and wear.  Its so subjective, and everyone has a different view on how their mouths should look and what color, so you have to take a few chances, but this is so good, you have to try it.

column6: This is an awesomely cool shade if your skin is cool toned
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2021
column14: This is an incredibly unique shade that borders on a grayish purple but it’s such a cool grungy look for any age person.  The only thing I don’t like about Loreal lipsticks is the perfume they insist on including in their formula.  I’ve actually avoided Loreal lipstick for a very long time but this limited edition X Balmain shade was just too tempting to pass on.  This is a unique shade that is a combo of gray/violet and brown.  But it’s not a really really cool toned brown and it’s not gray either.  It has just enough purple to be super flattering on my cool toned skin.  It wears “pretty” well, not the best and not the worst.  I wish it was a truly matte formula since those have a much longer wear time, no matter the brand.  I wish someone (smart) on the Loreal lipstick team would make a proposal to just take out the perfume.  No one WANTS perfume in their lipsticks.  Yes, some can live with it and are fine if there is perfume, but honesty, I don’t know a single person that would honestly say “oh yeah, gotta have perfume in this, no doubt about it.”

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
column14: it is my very first loreal lipstick purchase,and i've been looking for.this color for a while,so exciting that i found it here with a good price as well. the color is so beautiful, it can be wear with or without makeup and it matches both warm and cool undertone. a perfect color for autumn and winter! also i love the texture so much,creamy soft and hydrate. the only downside of it is the smell...later i bought few other loreal lipsticks and realised it might just all the loreals are smell like this...but it really bothers me....it can.be my favorite lipstick if it smells differently

column6: Love the color, hate the quality
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
column14: Unusual and interesting color. Looks dark khaki on lips (not really olive)— unless you were to neutralize lip color first. But it’s not worth that much prep work, because it does not last.  Coverage is patchy as well, and it has a tendency to bleed because the formulation is so soft. It’s a shame, because the shade could compliment many skin hues.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018
column14: Just received the color Fever and it's really pretty. It goes on smooth, maybe too velvety smooth since that usually means it'll fall right between the lines of my lips and it did. I can correct that with a lip primer, however, this has a particular smell to it. Reminds me of lipsticks I used to play with as a child. I absolutely loath perfume scents on my lipstick, smells cheap and not sure what kind of chemical they used in it at this point. Oh well, price of beauty!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
column14: It is high priced item among L’Oréal lipsticks. I bought it because some article mentioned it for its orange-like color. It ok and unique color for me.

column6: Creamy Matte Lipstick with Staying Power
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
column14: I love this new lipstick. It is deeply pigmented and lasts quite awhile, although it will transfer a little (due to the creamy formula.)  Shipped super fast. And the new packing is great!!!

column6: Wake up call to the lips!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2019
column14: I love this color, but I do have to tone it down with a lighter lipstick on top.  I am an 80 yr. old lady, & it is a bit bright for me. My face needs color, but maybe not that much. I do wear a lot of autumn colors & it is very pretty with those.
